feature.label: Arduino eclipse extensions
feature.description: This feature allows easy creation of arduino projects in a eclipse environment. The main features are a new arduino sketch wizard a import library wizard a button to build the project a button to upload to the arduino board a project property page allowing to change the arduino board type and the port the arduino is using. version 1_2_0 Added Com functionality. Available Com ports are listed where you can select a com port Now all arduino boards are reset when doing an upload. adde , to the list of non allowed characters version 1_1_6 Some board names contain ( and ) which gives problems when creating the arduino project names. This has been fixed now. When importing a library the selected project is used as the default project. Error handling during import pops up now Version 1_1_5 Mac os is supported now. This means the errors have been removed and the default values should be ok. Version 1_1_3 Fixes a bug that the latest used com port is used to uload a file to arduino. Now the correct set port is used. version 1_1_2 The ARDUINO define is now built based on the version.txt file. The in eclipse define has been removed. version 1_1_1 includes better error reporting (now errors are also shown in a dialog box and not only logged in the error log. Bixes a bug when that made the referenced project corrupt when changing the arduino board. version 1_1_0 is a major change. It fixed the incompatibilities with arduino 1.0 Therfore the arduino core library is replaced by arduino board library (ths was needed due to the pins_arduino I ow use the programmer as described in boards.txt version 1_0_9 fixed unix incompatibilities version 1_0_8 fixed the ok button not enabled in preference page version 1_0_7 changed licence agreement and fixes issues import of arduino library subforder "utilities" the c perspective is now proposed when a new project is created. version 1_0_6 add import library functionality previous versions are no longer available This is a plugin build upon the avr-eclise plugin. I included the avr-eclipse source code in this feature because I had to make some changes and didn't want to wait for the next version of the avr-eclipse plugin. To avoid conflict I had to rename de .innot to it.baeyens. I kept the same ID to keep the plugins data compatible. Jan
